page.title: 14LANDSCAPE..RURAL BUILDINGS
page.content: In our area there is a marked contrast between old ,traditional styled farm buildings and the new,mode fabricated structures which now seem to part of every farm.The old buildings made from local whinstone and sandstone,with slate or red pan tiled roofs are attracted,but farmers need the modern buildings to house machinery and large numbers of livestock.Hopefully farmers will be prepared to preserve the old farm steading buildings as they continue to adapt and change there farms to cope with new ideas about cropping,machinery,and livestock management.Most farm cottages are now owned privately and they are all in a good state of repair as they have all been renovated in recent years.Local authority grants have made it possible to keep these cottages in good order.
